title: "Separate longer"
---


The `separate_longer_delim()` function splits a string column into multiple rows by a delimiter. 
It is generally used with long data.

[Tidyverse reference page](https://tidyr.tidyverse.org//reference/separate_longer_delim.html)

## Dataset

For demonstration we'll load the `crop_and_soil_tbl` data from the [mgrtibbles package](/datasets/mgrtibbles.qmd) (hyperlink includes install instructions).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Load package
library("mgrtibbles")
#mammal_sleep_tbl tibble for demonstration
mgrtibbles::crop_and_soil_tbl
```

## Wide to long

Pivot the __wide tibble__ to a __long tibble__.

The three options provided below are:

- The columns to use for lengthening.
    - Below `!Entity` is used to lengthen all but the `Entity` column.
    - String vectors can be used.
- `names_to=`: New column in long data containing the __names__ of the lengthened columns.
- `values_to=`: New column in long data containing the __values__ of the lengthened columns.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fisheries_wide_tbl |> tidyr::pivot_longer(!Entity, names_to="Year", values_to = "Metric_tons")
```
